events.title: The Versailles Treaty is signed
events.description: The Treaty of Versailles was signed, officially ending World War I and imposing heavy reparations and territorial losses on Germany.
events.significance: Marked the formal end of WWI and reshaped the map of Europe, setting the stage for geopolitical tensions leading to WWII.

events.title: Battle of Midway begins
events.description: The Battle of Midway, a crucial naval battle in the Pacific Theater of World War II, began between the United States and Japan.
events.significance: A turning point in the Pacific War, severely weakening the Japanese fleet and shifting momentum to the Allies.

events.title: Tiananmen Square Massacre
events.description: Chinese troops and tanks suppressed pro-democracy protesters in Beijing's Tiananmen Square, resulting in hundreds to thousands of deaths.
events.significance: A significant event highlighting the Chinese Communist Party’s resistance to political reform and human rights movements.

events.title: First Father’s Day celebrated in the United States
events.description: The first official Father's Day was celebrated, organized by Sonora Smart Dodd to honor fathers and their contributions.
events.significance: Led to the establishment of Father's Day as an annual event in many countries to acknowledge fatherhood.
